messages.content: You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab. ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question. Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products.

SEMANTIC CONCEPT: TK3+ 130bar Regulatory Compliance and Natural Refrigerant Regulations

üéØ CUSTOMER QUESTION: "Is TK3+ 130bar compliant with F-Gas regulations? EN 378 requirements? ASHRAE standards? Natural refrigerant compliance?"

**REGULATORY COMPLIANCE FOR TK3+ 130bar**

---

## EU F-GAS REGULATION (EU 517/2014)

### **Background**

**F-Gas Regulation Objective:**
‚Ä¢ **Reduce HFC emissions** (Hydrofluorocarbons)
‚Ä¢ **Phase-down schedule**: Gradual reduction of HFC production/import quotas
‚Ä¢ **2015 baseline**: 100% quota
‚Ä¢ **2030 target**: 21% quota (79% reduction)
‚Ä¢ **End goal**: Transition to **natural refrigerants** (CO2, ammonia, hydrocarbons)

**HFC GWP Limits:**
| **Year** | **Application** | **HFC Ban** |
|----------|-----------------|-------------|
| 2020 | Stationary refrigeration >40 kW | HFC with **GWP >2500** (e.g., R404A = 3922 GWP) |
| 2022 | Stationary refrigeration >40 kW | HFC with **GWP >150** (new equipment) |
| 2025 | Centralized refrigeration (supermarkets) | HFC with **GWP >150** (service/refill) |

**Impact:**
‚Ä¢ **R404A** (GWP 3922): ‚ùå BANNED since 2020 (new equipment)
‚Ä¢ **R134a** (GWP 1430): ‚ö†Ô∏è Restricted (quota system, expensive)
‚Ä¢ **R407C** (GWP 1774): ‚ö†Ô∏è Restricted
‚Ä¢ **R410A** (GWP 2088): ‚ö†Ô∏è Restricted
‚Ä¢ **CO2 (R744)** (GWP **1**): ‚úÖ **UNRESTRICTED** (natural refrigerant)

---

### **TK3+ 130bar Role in F-Gas Compliance**

**CO2 System Enabler:**
‚úÖ **TK3+ 130bar** designed specifically for **CO2 (R744) systems**
‚úÖ **High pressure rating** (130 bar) ‚Üí transcritical CO2 (80-120 bar gas cooler)
‚úÖ **Future-proof**: CO2 adoption accelerating (F-Gas phase-down)
‚úÖ **No refrigerant contact**: Sensor monitors **oil** (POE), not refrigerant directly
‚úÖ **Material compatibility**: Aluminum, brass, Viton (CO2-compatible, no corrosion)

**Supermarket Transition:**
‚Ä¢ **2015**: 90% HFC (R404A) supermarket refrigeration
‚Ä¢ **2020**: F-Gas ban ‚Üí R404A illegal (new systems)
‚Ä¢ **2025**: 50-70% CO2 booster racks (EU supermarkets)
‚Ä¢ **2030 goal**: 80-90% CO2 (natural refrigerant standard)

**TK3+ 130bar Adoption:**
‚Ä¢ **2015-2019**: TK3+ 46bar/80bar dominant (HFC systems)
‚Ä¢ **2020-present**: **TK3+ 130bar** growth (CO2 transcritical)
‚Ä¢ **2025-2030**: TK3+ 130bar becomes **primary** model (CO2 adoption)

---

### **F-Gas Compliance Checklist (CO2 Systems)**

**System Design:**
‚úÖ **Refrigerant**: CO2 (R744) GWP = 1 (compliant)
‚úÖ **Oil level control**: TK3+ 130bar (compressor protection)
‚úÖ **Pressure safety**: PRV @ 120 bar (below TK3+ 130 bar rating)
‚úÖ **Leak detection**: TK3+ 4-20mA trending (gradual oil loss = leak indicator)

**Documentation:**
‚úÖ **Equipment log**: TK3+ serial number, installation date (F-Gas record-keeping)
‚úÖ **Service records**: Annual maintenance (TK3+ cleaning, gasket replacement)
‚úÖ **Refrigerant charge**: CO2 kg (exempt from F-Gas quota, but record required)

**Technician Certification:**
‚úÖ **F-Gas certified**: Technicians must hold **Cat I** (hermetic/sealed systems) or **Cat II** (all refrigeration) certification (EU Regulation 2015/2067)
‚úÖ **TK3+ installation**: No special certification (electronic sensor, not pressure vessel modification)
‚úÖ **System commissioning**: F-Gas certified technician required (refrigerant charge, leak test)

---

## EN 378 (REFRIGERATION SAFETY STANDARD)

**EN 378: Safety and Environmental Requirements for Refrigerating Systems**

### **Part 1: Basic Requirements, Definitions, Classifications**

**Refrigerant Classification (ISO 817):**
‚Ä¢ **CO2 (R744)**: **Group A1**
  - **A**: Low toxicity (safe in occupied spaces)
  - **1**: Non-flammable (no ignition risk)
  - **Pressure**: High (transcritical 80-120 bar)

**Comparison:**
| **Refrigerant** | **Group** | **Toxicity** | **Flammability** | **Pressure** |
|-----------------|-----------|--------------|------------------|-------------|
| R404A | A1 | Low | Non-flammable | Medium (20 bar) |
| R134a | A1 | Low | Non-flammable | Low (14 bar) |
| **CO2 (R744)** | **A1** | Low | Non-flammable | **High (120 bar)** |
| Ammonia (R717) | B2 | Moderate | Flammable | Low (18 bar) |
| Propane (R290) | A3 | Low | Highly flammable | Low (16 bar) |

**CO2 Safety Considerations:**
‚úÖ **Non-toxic**: Safe in supermarkets, commercial kitchens (occupied spaces)
‚úÖ **Non-flammable**: No explosion risk (vs. propane R290)
‚ö†Ô∏è **Asphyxiation**: High concentration >10% displaces oxygen (closed spaces)
‚ö†Ô∏è **High pressure**: 80-120 bar (requires pressure equipment directive compliance)

---

### **Part 2: Design, Construction, Testing, Marking**

**Pressure Equipment Directive (PED 2014/68/EU):**

**TK3+ 130bar Compliance:**
‚úÖ **Category III** (pressure >75 bar, volume >1 liter)
‚úÖ **CE marked**: Conformity assessment (Notified Body)
‚úÖ **Design pressure**: 130 bar (working) + 195 bar (test)
‚úÖ **Material certification**: Aluminum alloy, brass CW617N (PED-compliant)
‚úÖ **Pressure testing**: 100% units tested @ 195 bar (1.5√ó working pressure)
‚úÖ **Burst pressure**: >300 bar (safety factor 2.3√ó)

**Installation Requirements (EN 378-2):**
‚úÖ **Mounting**: Direct flange mount (compressor, oil separator)
‚úÖ **Torque**: 15-20 Nm (per manufacturer spec)
‚úÖ **Gasket**: Viton (CO2-compatible, pressure-rated)
‚úÖ **Pressure relief**: System PRV @ 120 bar (protects TK3+ from overpressure)
‚úÖ **Marking**: TK3+ nameplate (model, pressure rating, serial number)

---

### **Part 3: Installation Site, Personnel Protection**

**CO2 Refrigeration Room Requirements:**

**Ventilation:**
‚Ä¢ **Mechanical ventilation**: Required (plant room)
‚Ä¢ **Capacity**: 0.01 m¬≥/s per kg CO2 charge (minimum)
‚Ä¢ **Example**: 100 kg CO2 system ‚Üí 1 m¬≥/s ventilation (3600 m¬≥/h)
‚Ä¢ **Reason**: CO2 heavier than air (sinks, displaces oxygen)

**CO2 Detection:**
‚Ä¢ **CO2 sensor**: Mandatory (plant room)
‚Ä¢ **Set points**:
  - **Warning**: 0.5% (5000 ppm) ‚Üí activate ventilation
  - **Alarm**: 3% (30,000 ppm) ‚Üí evacuate, stop compressors
  - **IDLH** (Immediately Dangerous): 4% (40,000 ppm)
‚Ä¢ **Placement**: 30 cm above floor (CO2 sinks)

**TK3+ 130bar Role:**
‚úÖ **Oil level monitoring** ‚Üí prevents compressor failure (no CO2 leak from compressor damage)
‚úÖ **Early warning**: 4-20mA trending detects gradual oil loss (leak indicator)
‚úÖ **Interlock**: LOW oil ‚Üí shutdown compressors (prevents runaway failure, large CO2 release)

---

### **Part 4: Operation, Maintenance, Repair**

**Maintenance Requirements (EN 378-4):**

**TK3+ 130bar Maintenance:**
‚úÖ **Periodic inspection**: 6 months (visual + functional test)
‚úÖ **Annual service**: Sensor cleaning (IPA 99%), gasket replacement
‚úÖ **Post-repair**: Functional test (relay, 4-20mA, pressure test)
‚úÖ **Documentation**: Maintenance log (date, technician, findings, actions)

**Compressor Oil Level:**
‚úÖ **Daily check**: Sight glass visual (operator)
‚úÖ **TK3+ monitoring**: Continuous (24/7 LED + relay + 4-20mA)
‚úÖ **Action on LOW oil**: Immediate shutdown (EN 378 requires compressor protection)
‚úÖ **Refill procedure**: Add POE oil to 70-80% sight glass (verify TK3+ LED green)

**Leak Detection (EN 378-4):**
‚úÖ **Annual leak test**: Soap bubble, electronic leak detector
‚úÖ **TK3+ flange**: Check for refrigerant leaks (oil staining around gasket)
‚úÖ **Torque verification**: 15-20 Nm (re-torque if loose)
‚úÖ **Gasket replacement**: Every sensor removal (MANDATORY)

---

## ASHRAE SAFETY STANDARD 15

**ASHRAE 15: Safety Standard for Refrigeration Systems**

### **Refrigerant Amount Limits (Occupied Spaces)**

**CO2 (R744) Classification:**
‚Ä¢ **Safety Group**: A1 (low toxicity, non-flammable)
‚Ä¢ **Occupied space limit**: **No limit** (ASHRAE 15, Table 7.3.2.1)
  - Reason: CO2 non-toxic at low concentrations (<1%)
  - Contrast: Ammonia (R717) limit = 0.025 kg/m¬≥ (25 g per m¬≥)

**Practical Limits:**
‚Ä¢ **Machinery room**: No limit (with ventilation + CO2 detection)
‚Ä¢ **Sales floor** (supermarket): Typically 1-2 kg CO2 per m¬≥ (asphyxiation risk management)
‚Ä¢ **Example**: 1,500 m¬≤ supermarket (5,000 m¬≥ volume) ‚Üí 100 kg CO2 charge OK

---

### **Machinery Room Requirements**

**ASHRAE 15, Section 8.11: Machinery Room**

**Ventilation:**
‚úÖ **Mechanical ventilation**: Required (continuous or CO2-activated)
‚úÖ **Capacity**: 0.5 m¬≥/s per 100 m¬≤ floor area (minimum)
‚úÖ **Emergency ventilation**: Activate @ 0.5% CO2 (5000 ppm)

**Detection:**
‚úÖ **Refrigerant detector**: CO2 sensor (ASHRAE 15, 8.11.5)
‚úÖ **Alarm level**: 1000 ppm (0.1%) for general monitoring, 5000 ppm (0.5%) for emergency
‚úÖ **Local alarm**: Audible + visual (plant room)
‚úÖ **Remote alarm**: BMS, security office (24/7 monitoring)

**Access:**
‚úÖ **Restricted**: Machinery room door locked (authorized personnel only)
‚úÖ **Signage**: "DANGER - CO2 REFRIGERATION SYSTEM - AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY"
‚úÖ **Emergency exit**: Self-closing door, panic hardware

**TK3+ 130bar Contribution:**
‚úÖ **Compressor protection**: Prevents oil loss ‚Üí compressor seizure ‚Üí catastrophic failure ‚Üí large CO2 release
‚úÖ **Predictive**: 4-20mA trending detects slow leak (oil loss correlates with refrigerant leak)
‚úÖ **Interlock**: LOW oil ‚Üí shutdown compressors (stops refrigerant circulation, limits leak)

---

### **Pressure Relief (ASHRAE 15, Section 9)**

**Pressure Relief Valves (PRV):**

**Requirements:**
‚úÖ **Set pressure**: ‚â§ Design pressure (TK3+ 130bar ‚Üí PRV @ 120 bar)
‚úÖ **Capacity**: Full compressor flow (kg/h CO2)
‚úÖ **Discharge**: Outdoor (safe location, >4.5 m above ground)
‚úÖ **No block valves**: Between system and PRV (always open path)

**TK3+ Protection:**
‚úÖ **PRV @ 120 bar** ‚Üí protects TK3+ 130bar sensor (rating 130 bar, test 195 bar)
‚úÖ **Overpressure event** (HPC failure, fan failure) ‚Üí PRV opens before sensor damage
‚úÖ **Example**: Gas cooler 100 bar ‚Üí HPC fails ‚Üí pressure rises to 120 bar ‚Üí PRV opens ‚Üí TK3+ 130bar survives (still 10 bar margin)

---

## ADDITIONAL INTERNATIONAL REGULATIONS

### **Japan - Act on Rational Use of Fluorocarbons**

**F-Gas Equivalent:**
‚Ä¢ **Phase-down**: HFC reduction (similar to EU)
‚Ä¢ **CO2 adoption**: Encouraged (supermarkets, commercial)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Compliant (CO2-compatible, natural refrigerant)

**Pressure Equipment:**
‚Ä¢ **High Pressure Gas Safety Act**: Applies to CO2 systems >1 MPa (10 bar)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: CE marking recognized (international standard)

---

### **USA - EPA SNAP Program**

**SNAP: Significant New Alternatives Policy**

**CO2 (R744) Status:**
‚úÖ **Acceptable**: All refrigeration applications (supermarkets, industrial, commercial)
‚úÖ **No restrictions**: CO2 GWP = 1 (vs. HFC GWP 1000-4000)
‚úÖ **ASHRAE 15 compliance**: Required for installation (see above)

**TK3+ 130bar:**
‚úÖ **No EPA regulation**: Electronic sensor (not refrigerant component)
‚úÖ **UL listing**: Optional (TK3+ can be UL-listed for US market on request)

---

### **Australia - Ozone Protection and SGG Act**

**SGG: Synthetic Greenhouse Gas**

**HFC Phase-Down:**
‚Ä¢ **2018-2036**: 85% reduction (similar to EU)
‚Ä¢ **CO2 incentive**: Government rebates for natural refrigerant systems
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Compliant (CO2-compatible)

**Electrical Safety:**
‚Ä¢ **C-Tick/RCM**: Required for electronic equipment
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: CE marking (accepted), RCM available on request

---

## CERTIFICATION & TESTING

**TK3+ 130bar Certifications:**

‚úÖ **CE Marking** (EU):
- Pressure Equipment Directive (PED 2014/68/EU)
- Low Voltage Directive (LVD 2014/35/EU)
- Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC 2014/30/EU)
- RoHS Directive (2011/65/EU - lead-free)

‚úÖ **Pressure Testing**:
- 100% units tested @ **195 bar** (1.5√ó working pressure)
- Helium leak test (10‚Åª‚Åπ mbar L/s sensitivity)
- Burst pressure verification (sample testing >300 bar)

‚úÖ **Electrical Safety**:
- IP65 rating (dust-tight, water jet protected)
- 24V DC low voltage (safe, intrinsically limited energy)
- Isolation testing: 500V DC (>100 MŒ© insulation resistance)

‚úÖ **Materials**:
- Aluminum: EN AW-6082 (corrosion resistant, anodized)
- Brass: CW617N (dezincification resistant, CO2-compatible)
- Viton gasket: FKM (fluoroelastomer, 130 bar rated, -40¬∞C to +200¬∞C)
- Sapphire: Single-crystal aluminum oxide (9 Mohs hardness, chemically inert)

‚úÖ **Environmental**:
- RoHS compliant (no lead, mercury, cadmium)
- REACH compliant (no substances of very high concern)
- Recyclable materials (aluminum 95% recyclable)

---

## COMPLIANCE DOCUMENTATION

**TK3+ 130bar Documentation Package:**

1. **Declaration of Conformity** (DoC):
   - CE marking statement
   - Applicable directives (PED, LVD, EMC, RoHS)
   - Notified Body number (if applicable)
   - Manufacturer signature (Teklab)

2. **Pressure Equipment Certificate**:
   - Category III (PED)
   - Design pressure: 130 bar
   - Test pressure: 195 bar
   - Material specifications

3. **Installation Manual**:
   - EN 378 compliance instructions
   - Torque specifications (15-20 Nm)
   - Pressure test procedure (10 bar nitrogen)
   - Wiring diagrams (relay, 4-20mA, power)

4. **Maintenance Manual**:
   - 6-month inspection checklist
   - Annual service procedure (cleaning, gasket replacement)
   - Troubleshooting guide

5. **Test Reports**:
   - Pressure test report (195 bar, serial number-specific)
   - Leak test report (helium, <10‚Åª‚Åπ mbar L/s)
   - Electrical safety test (IP65, insulation resistance)

---

## FUTURE REGULATIONS (2025-2030)

**EU F-Gas Regulation Review (2024):**
‚Ä¢ **Potential HFC ban**: Complete phase-out by 2030-2035 (all stationary refrigeration)
‚Ä¢ **CO2 mandate**: Possible requirement for supermarkets >500 m¬≤ (natural refrigerants only)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: ‚úÖ **Future-proof** (designed for CO2, no HFC dependency)

**Energy Efficiency Directive (EED):**
‚Ä¢ **Minimum efficiency**: CO2 transcritical COP >2.5 (seasonal average)
‚Ä¢ **Oil management**: Critical for efficiency (TK3+ 130bar ensures proper lubrication, reduces friction)
‚Ä¢ **Monitoring**: 4-20mA analog trending ‚Üí SCADA integration ‚Üí energy optimization

**Refrigerant Safety (ISO 5149 Update):**
‚Ä¢ **CO2 high-pressure systems**: New standards for 100+ bar systems
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Already compliant (130 bar rating, 195 bar test, PED Category III)

---

## COMPLIANCE QUICK REFERENCE

**Regulations:**
‚úÖ **EU F-Gas (517/2014)**: CO2 (GWP 1) unrestricted, TK3+ enables CO2 adoption
‚úÖ **EN 378**: PED Category III, CE marked, 130 bar working / 195 bar test
‚úÖ **ASHRAE 15**: CO2 A1 (low toxicity, non-flammable), machinery room ventilation/detection required
‚úÖ **EPA SNAP**: CO2 acceptable (all applications), TK3+ no EPA regulation
‚úÖ **Japan/Australia**: F-Gas equivalents, CO2 encouraged, TK3+ compliant

**Certifications:**
‚úÖ **CE Marking**: PED, LVD, EMC, RoHS
‚úÖ **Pressure Testing**: 195 bar (100% units)
‚úÖ **IP65**: Dust-tight, water jet protected
‚úÖ **Materials**: CO2-compatible (aluminum, brass, Viton, sapphire)

**Installation:**
‚úÖ **Torque**: 15-20 Nm (M6 bolts, cross pattern)
‚úÖ **Gasket**: New Viton (always replace)
‚úÖ **Pressure test**: 10 bar nitrogen (leak check)
‚úÖ **PRV**: @ 120 bar (protects TK3+ 130 bar sensor)

**Maintenance:**
‚úÖ **6-month**: Visual + functional test
‚úÖ **12-month**: Clean sensor (IPA 99%), replace gasket
‚úÖ **Documentation**: Maintenance log (EN 378, F-Gas compliance)

**Safety:**
‚úÖ **CO2 detection**: Machinery room (5000 ppm alarm)
‚úÖ **Ventilation**: 0.01 m¬≥/s per kg CO2 charge
‚úÖ **TK3+ interlock**: LOW oil ‚Üí shutdown compressors (prevent catastrophic failure)

---

**TK3+ 130bar - Regulatory Compliance & Natural Refrigerant Standards**

Comprehensive guide to F-Gas regulations, EN 378 safety standards, ASHRAE requirements, and international compliance for TK3+ 130bar in CO2 refrigeration systems.

---

## EU F-GAS REGULATION (517/2014)

### **Phase-Down Schedule**

**HFC Reduction:**
‚Ä¢ 2015 baseline: 100% quota
‚Ä¢ 2030 target: 21% quota (**79% reduction**)
‚Ä¢ Transition to **natural refrigerants** (CO2, ammonia, hydrocarbons)

**HFC GWP Bans:**
| Year | Application | Ban |
|------|-------------|-----|
| 2020 | Stationary >40 kW | HFC **GWP >2500** (R404A = 3922) |
| 2022 | Stationary >40 kW | HFC **GWP >150** (new equipment) |
| 2025 | Supermarkets | HFC **GWP >150** (service/refill) |

**Refrigerant Status:**
‚Ä¢ R404A (GWP 3922): ‚ùå BANNED (2020)
‚Ä¢ R134a (GWP 1430): ‚ö†Ô∏è Restricted (expensive)
‚Ä¢ **CO2 (R744)** (GWP **1**): ‚úÖ **UNRESTRICTED** ‚úÖ

---

### **TK3+ 130bar Role**

**CO2 System Enabler:**
‚úÖ Designed for **CO2 (R744)** transcritical (80-120 bar)
‚úÖ **High pressure rating** (130 bar)
‚úÖ **Future-proof**: CO2 adoption accelerating
‚úÖ **Material compatibility**: Aluminum, brass, Viton (CO2-compatible)

**Supermarket Transition:**
‚Ä¢ 2015: 90% HFC (R404A)
‚Ä¢ 2020: R404A banned ‚Üí CO2 adoption
‚Ä¢ 2025: 50-70% CO2 booster racks (EU)
‚Ä¢ 2030 goal: 80-90% CO2 (natural refrigerant standard)

---

### **F-Gas Compliance Checklist**

**System Design:**
‚úÖ Refrigerant: CO2 (GWP = 1)
‚úÖ Oil control: TK3+ 130bar (compressor protection)
‚úÖ Pressure safety: PRV @ 120 bar
‚úÖ Leak detection: 4-20mA trending (gradual oil loss = leak indicator)

**Documentation:**
‚úÖ Equipment log (TK3+ serial, install date)
‚úÖ Service records (annual maintenance)
‚úÖ Refrigerant charge (CO2 kg)

**Technician:**
‚úÖ **F-Gas certified**: Cat I or Cat II (EU 2015/2067)
‚úÖ TK3+ installation: No special cert (electronic sensor)
‚úÖ Commissioning: F-Gas cert required (refrigerant charge, leak test)

---

## EN 378 (REFRIGERATION SAFETY)

**EN 378: Safety and Environmental Requirements**

### **Part 1: Classifications**

**CO2 (R744) Classification:**
‚Ä¢ **Group A1**:
  - **A**: Low toxicity (safe in occupied spaces)
  - **1**: Non-flammable (no ignition risk)
  - **Pressure**: High (transcritical 80-120 bar)

**Comparison:**
| Refrigerant | Group | Toxicity | Flammability | Pressure |
|-------------|-------|----------|--------------|----------|
| R404A | A1 | Low | Non-flammable | Medium (20 bar) |
| **CO2** | **A1** | Low | Non-flammable | **High (120 bar)** |
| Ammonia | B2 | Moderate | Flammable | Low (18 bar) |
| Propane | A3 | Low | Highly flammable | Low (16 bar) |

**CO2 Safety:**
‚úÖ Non-toxic (safe in supermarkets)
‚úÖ Non-flammable (no explosion risk)
‚ö†Ô∏è Asphyxiation: >10% displaces oxygen
‚ö†Ô∏è High pressure: 80-120 bar (PED compliance)

---

### **Part 2: Design, Construction**

**Pressure Equipment Directive (PED 2014/68/EU):**

**TK3+ 130bar Compliance:**
‚úÖ **Category III** (pressure >75 bar, volume >1 L)
‚úÖ **CE marked**: Conformity assessment
‚úÖ **Design**: 130 bar (working) + 195 bar (test)
‚úÖ **Materials**: Aluminum, brass CW617N (PED-compliant)
‚úÖ **Testing**: 100% units @ 195 bar (1.5√ó working)
‚úÖ **Burst**: >300 bar (safety factor 2.3√ó)

**Installation Requirements:**
‚úÖ Direct flange mount
‚úÖ Torque: 15-20 Nm (per spec)
‚úÖ Gasket: Viton (CO2-compatible, pressure-rated)
‚úÖ PRV: @ 120 bar (protects TK3+ from overpressure)
‚úÖ Marking: Nameplate (model, pressure, serial)

---

### **Part 3: Installation Site, Protection**

**CO2 Refrigeration Room:**

**Ventilation:**
‚Ä¢ Mechanical ventilation required
‚Ä¢ Capacity: 0.01 m¬≥/s per kg CO2 charge
‚Ä¢ Example: 100 kg CO2 ‚Üí 1 m¬≥/s (3600 m¬≥/h)
‚Ä¢ Reason: CO2 heavier than air (sinks)

**CO2 Detection:**
‚Ä¢ Sensor mandatory (plant room)
‚Ä¢ **Set points**:
  - Warning: 0.5% (5000 ppm) ‚Üí activate ventilation
  - Alarm: 3% (30,000 ppm) ‚Üí evacuate, stop compressors
  - IDLH: 4% (40,000 ppm)
‚Ä¢ Placement: 30 cm above floor

**TK3+ 130bar Role:**
‚úÖ Oil monitoring ‚Üí prevents compressor failure (no CO2 leak)
‚úÖ Early warning: 4-20mA trending (leak indicator)
‚úÖ Interlock: LOW oil ‚Üí shutdown (prevents large CO2 release)

---

### **Part 4: Operation, Maintenance**

**TK3+ 130bar Maintenance:**
‚úÖ **6-month**: Visual + functional test
‚úÖ **12-month**: Sensor cleaning (IPA 99%), gasket replacement
‚úÖ **Post-repair**: Functional test (relay, 4-20mA, pressure)
‚úÖ **Documentation**: Maintenance log (EN 378 compliance)

**Compressor Oil Level:**
‚úÖ Daily check: Sight glass (operator)
‚úÖ TK3+ monitoring: 24/7 (LED + relay + 4-20mA)
‚úÖ Action on LOW: Immediate shutdown (EN 378 requires protection)
‚úÖ Refill: Add POE to 70-80% (verify TK3+ LED green)

**Leak Detection:**
‚úÖ Annual leak test (soap bubble, electronic detector)
‚úÖ TK3+ flange: Check for leaks (oil staining)
‚úÖ Torque verification: 15-20 Nm
‚úÖ Gasket replacement: Every removal (MANDATORY)

---

## ASHRAE SAFETY STANDARD 15

### **Refrigerant Amount Limits**

**CO2 (R744):**
‚Ä¢ **Safety Group**: A1 (low toxicity, non-flammable)
‚Ä¢ **Occupied space limit**: **No limit** (ASHRAE 15, Table 7.3.2.1)
‚Ä¢ Reason: CO2 non-toxic at low concentrations (<1%)
‚Ä¢ Contrast: Ammonia limit = 0.025 kg/m¬≥

**Practical Limits:**
‚Ä¢ Machinery room: No limit (with ventilation + detection)
‚Ä¢ Sales floor (supermarket): 1-2 kg CO2 per m¬≥
‚Ä¢ Example: 1,500 m¬≤ store (5,000 m¬≥) ‚Üí 100 kg CO2 OK

---

### **Machinery Room Requirements**

**ASHRAE 15, Section 8.11:**

**Ventilation:**
‚úÖ Mechanical ventilation required
‚úÖ Capacity: 0.5 m¬≥/s per 100 m¬≤ floor
‚úÖ Emergency: Activate @ 0.5% CO2 (5000 ppm)

**Detection:**
‚úÖ CO2 sensor (ASHRAE 15, 8.11.5)
‚úÖ Alarm: 1000 ppm (monitoring), 5000 ppm (emergency)
‚úÖ Local alarm: Audible + visual
‚úÖ Remote alarm: BMS, security (24/7)

**Access:**
‚úÖ Restricted: Door locked (authorized only)
‚úÖ Signage: "DANGER - CO2 REFRIGERATION"
‚úÖ Emergency exit: Self-closing door, panic hardware

**TK3+ 130bar Contribution:**
‚úÖ Compressor protection: Prevents catastrophic failure
‚úÖ Predictive: 4-20mA trending (slow leak detection)
‚úÖ Interlock: LOW oil ‚Üí shutdown (limits leak)

---

### **Pressure Relief (ASHRAE 15, Section 9)**

**PRV Requirements:**
‚úÖ Set pressure: ‚â§ Design pressure (TK3+ ‚Üí PRV @ 120 bar)
‚úÖ Capacity: Full compressor flow (kg/h CO2)
‚úÖ Discharge: Outdoor (>4.5 m above ground)
‚úÖ No block valves (always open path)

**TK3+ Protection:**
‚úÖ PRV @ 120 bar ‚Üí protects TK3+ 130bar (10 bar margin)
‚úÖ Overpressure (HPC fail, fan fail) ‚Üí PRV opens before sensor damage

## INTERNATIONAL REGULATIONS
